text: Joseph Henry "Joe" Tiller (December 7, 1942 – September 30, 2017) was an American football player and coach. He was born in Toledo, Ohio. Tiller served as the head football coach at the University of Wyoming from 1991 to 1996 and Purdue University from 1997 to 2008, having a career college football record of 126–92–1. Tiller was known as one of the innovators of the spread offense. He played for the Calgary Stampeders and for the Montana State Bobcats. Tiller died on September 30, 2017 in Buffalo, Wyoming at the age of 74. ==References== ==Other websites== * Purdue profile Category:1942 births Category:2017 deaths Category:American football players Category:American football coaches Category:Calgary Stampeders players Category:Sportspeople from Wyoming Category:Sportspeople from Toledo, Ohio Category:Disease-related deaths in Wyoming
title: Joe Tiller
